Title: Collecting Donations for a New Building
Location: Glasgow, Scotland, United Kingdom
Story: Summary:- What your Donations could do for us  We could have a much larger impact on the wider community  with things such as larger donation of food to the homeless  establishment of Foodbanks for the disadvantaged  medical facilities to aid in the care of elderly  Education facilities for ages of children and adults  a Day Centre for the elderly to meet each other and to pass their time.     Based in the Southside of Glasgow  we are a Sikh Temple which has been established since the late 1960's. To establish this organisation  a small group of people got together and donated money to buy this property.  Our Sikh faith is based on three key principle's:-   1. remember one God    2. to earn an honest living and   3. to share a proportion of one's earning to a needy cause  no matter what race  religion or background they are from.    Since then  the Temple has been running on donations and still continues to run today. We are a non profit making organisation.   Over the years  our community has grown and our donations have grown.  However  our current property is in need of modernisation.  Our community feels that rather than spending money on an old building  it maybe better to take down the old building  and to erect a new larger building. Our current setting does not allow disabled access for the elderly and infirm.    We hold congregations every Sunday where people come to worship their faith  and meals are freshly made and served free of charge. We have teamed up with a Glasgow Charity and have been providing them excess food for some time to feed the homeless and needy.    We feel that if we have bigger premises  we can contribute even more to the wider community as a whole.    We could have a much larger impact on the wider community  with things such as larger donation of food to the homeless  establishment of Foodbanks for the disadvantaged  medical facilities to aid in the care of elderly  Education facilities for ages of children and adults  a Day Centre for the elderly to meet each other and to pass their time.    We have collected donations through the community and are still short of funding.   We are therefore seeking funding from the public for staged building of the new Sikh Gurdwara.    Our overall  project cost will be £2.2 million pounds  The amount which we are looking for would bridge the requirement for the building of the concrete foundations of this building.    Please see our photos of the existing building and proposed building.    Your support will help us to build a new building so we may serve the community    We would appreciate any donations  however big or small.  Thank you for your support.            Link to our Website

Title: A women without shelter with newborn baby
Location: Harrow, Greater London, United Kingdom
Story: I am a woman without no money I live in a shearing house I just give birth two months ago I am not working my husband is not working we are struggling a lot he is not allowed to work because he is refugees he is not allowed work till he get his visa and I have baby I can’t work no one is here to look after her I only have one brother he pay our rent he give us some little money for groceries before I was pregnant I was looking for job every where I go when they were find out I were pregnant no one was accepting me one day I Apply for a job finally the called they said come for work but they were not know that I am 7 months pregnant I wore big dress that u can’t see my tommy I signs the contract and the take me as a sale assistant when my manager find out that I am pregnant he was really angry at me he said u should tell me before that ur pregnant I said if I were u would not take me before they were given lot of hours and I was happy to work when the new manager come when he find out I were pregnant he cut all my houser I was only working 3 days for four hours I was keep tell him please can u give me more hours but he was like we don’t have more hours but he was giveing for other people then after 3 months I was nine months pregnant 15 days before my baby born I left the job I told them could guys give me maternity leave they said we can’t u should work for a company 6 months then u can get but I were only worked for three months now I am struggling a lot I get no benefit from government my health vister god bless her she give me two time foodbank vouchers then someone me told me why u not asking from people help in this website I am trying to get shelter for my self my own house I trying to make for my newborn baby the best life ever hopefully people can help me and understand my pain sorry guys I make u sad even ur one pound is a lot for me god bless ur all

Title: 1 Year, 12 Charities Ending Homelessness & Hunger
Location: Bexley, Greater London, United Kingdom
Story: In the 2020 I will be raising £100 every month for 12 months  for 12 different charities to hit a fundraising goal of £1 200    **January's fundraiser is for The Trussell Trust and an essential £100 shop for Bexley Foodbank **    Each charity will be dedicated to ending homelessness and hunger in the UK because I believe those who are most vulnerable in our society deserve the most attention.    I will be taking on a different activity  challenge or event each month of the year for the 12 different charities. Sometimes I will be using other event fundraising pages for specific events  but everything raised will be channelled through this Justgiving page and you should feel free to donate here towards the total goal if you like!    If I manage to hit my goal or raising £300 in the first three months of the year I'm thinking of adding something really crazy as a fundraising activity later in the year...    The plan for the year is as follows:    January - The Trussell Trust : Raising money to buy desperately needed items for Bexley Foodbank where I volunteer and will be delivering a shop this weekend that depends on how much is raised on this Justgiving page in the remainder of January!!        February - Streetlink : Event TBC    March - Crisis : Taking part in Step Forward To End Homelessness where I will walk 135 miles (and I will walk 314 800 steps more) in the month!    April - December: TBC as more activities and events appear throughout the year!    The other charities I will be raising money for are Shelter  St. Mungos  Fareshare  Centrepoint  The Felix Project  The Big Issue Foundation  Depaul UK  The Salvation Army & Emmaus UK .

Title: Food For Many
Location: Dover, South East England, United Kingdom
Story: https://youtu.be/KqSvoeQZ4_M    ‘Tis the season to share  and who better to share with than others? Every year  thousands of people doesn’t have enough to eat and then to food banks in order to eat. The Dover food bank distributed over 3336 food parcels 2018-2019  36% were to children. Food banks see a spike in demand in the run up to Christmas as they do all they can to make sure people aren’t left hungry over the festive season. For this reason they need all the help they can get  to make sure nobody is turned away. Without donations and fundraisers from us who can give  this wouldn’t be possible. Even just a couple of pounds can make a real difference to people in crisis over Christmas  making sure that food banks are able to meet demand and provide a holiday treat for those in need.     From what I've seen  I can say that what the food bank does a great job  and the volunteers are the most wonderful people there is. They listen to you and wants what’s best for you! For these reasons I’m starting this GoFundMe  to make sure that the people who is in need of a food parcel can get one this Christmas  and a few treats too. It’s not about the amount you donate  it’s about giving  and even a couple of pounds can go a long way.    For example  1£ can buy 5 packs of spaghetti. 2£ can get 3 cans of tuna. 3£ buys 18 toilet rolls. So  as you can see even a small donation can help many people. How this works is; When the fundraiser is over  I will be withdrawing the money from the fundraiser  go to the shop and do a massive haul with it for the Dover Foodbank. The food will then be donated directly to the food bank along with any change left over. I’ll be bringing my camera with me to film the whole thing  and post pictures of the receipts and the haul. Afterwards the video of the haul will be put on YouTube.

Title: Crochet & Natter - free crochet classes for all
Location: London, Greater London, United Kingdom
Story: Hi  my name is Sylvia Becker and I am the founder of 'Crochet 'n Natter'  a community group based in Eltham  South East London.    I founded this community group back in 2017  because I wanted to give something to the community and I wanted to spread the love to and increase the appreciation of the art of crochet to people who cannot afford paying for workshops and lessons or are looking for a way to socialise with others on a regular basis.    Until March 2020 I held two weekly sessions and since then I host on-line sessions. During the sessions up to 20 people joined in from various backgrounds  the oldest member who joined on regular basis is 91 years  we have one member using a wheelchair ...    I decided to start a fundraising project because I my heart lies in this project. I want to continue on a free basis: online as long as possible  because it reaches a wider public and as soon as possible again 'in person'.     The funds will be used for:     • Subscription for an online video-conferencing platform.  • Enhancing my equipment. I would love to buy a document camera to make it easier to 'teach' various stitches.  •'Emergency' supply of yarn and crochet hooks for people in need.  • A 'free' cuppa for people in need.   • Venue hire costs.  • Printing costs for leaflets (so people can be reached who cannot use the Internet).  • Compensation for time and travel costs organising and running this project.     Why crochet in the community?    • It is an inexpensive way to be creative  you only need a hook  some yarn and some creative ideas.  • Crochet is a popular art  practised over centuries (the origins are unclear but very popular in Europe since the 19th century).  • Crocheting has various health benefits  like reducing stress  practising fine motor skills: with only knowing one stich you can already do a great mindfulness exercise.    .... and of course ....    • You can create something beautiful and unique for yourself  your friends or your loved ones.    Also crocheting can increase someone’s social network. In a social group people can meet  can talk  be inspired and inspire others  which can enhance social abilities.    I want to combine these positive effects of crochet in our Eltham community and I want to continue to host 2 sessions of 'Crochet 'n Natter' on a weekly basis.     The sessions are open for everyone who is interested in learning or improving a new skill (crochet)  or just want to socialize.     I want to use crochet as a medium to connect the community and offer a free opportunity for people to come together and be creative. The participants are welcome to come for any number of sessions.    I have run free sessions in the local community which have been very popular  and I am sure that there is interest and developing a project would be popular and advantageous to the community.     The in person session will give the Eltham community the chance to join in arts/ creative activities and brings the community together.     I also want to try taking part in local events as a community. Last year we participated in a local festival with creating and displaying a wall hanging  which is later donated to Eltham Library. We also had a Chrismas Sale and donated 25% of the proceeds to the local Foodbank. The rest we used to pay partly for our Christmas lunch.    During the sessions participants will be encouraged to share their (increased) skills with other participants and volunteer to help organise events/ sessions.    Your donation would really help me keeping and developing this beautiful project.     Thank you so much if you decide to support me. Your help is really appreciated.    Sylvia

Title: Struggling to survive mental distress
Location: Largs, Scotland, United Kingdom
Story: My parents passed within 10 weeks of each other. As I was alone in having to arrange both services I did not have time to grieve. My partner chose this time to be unfaithful and leave me with no support whatsoever. For the last 6 months I have found myself disolving into what can only be called a never ending nightmare circle of depression and ruin. I am trying to pull myself together and be positive but having increasing debts  depending on foodbanks and now facing eviction I can't see any light at the end of the tunnel. My only saving grace is my little dog. If it wasn't for her I would've given up long ago. I am under doctors supervision but my health has declined steadily along with everything else. I have worked all my life up till this all started but now at 60 years old I feel worthless. If anyone can please spare a little no matter how small it would be greatly appreciated. God bless you all.

Title: #BeyondYourFourWalls
Location: Manchester, North West England, United Kingdom
Story: During this time of lock down we at GYLF UK are looking at the world outside our windowsill  the world beyond our four walls. One of these things is hunger. Hunger is also known as food insecurity.    Did you know :  - 8.4 million people in the UK are struggling to afford to eat. This is equivalent to the entire population of London.  - More than half of those suffering from food insecurity (4.7 million people) are classified as severely food insecure  sometimes going an entire day without any food at all.  - Although hunger is a severe issue  1.9 million tonnes of food is wasted by the food industry every year in the UK.     We are going to take a step to reduce the impact as we couldn't sit back and watch this.    Join us as we :  - Donate food to foodbanks.  - Donate money to charities who are currently working to tackle this issue.  - Support charities who are understaffed and facing this current crisis.    Isaiah 58:10 New Living Translation (NLT)  "Feed the hungry    and help those in trouble.  Then your light will shine out from the darkness    and the darkness around you will be as bright as noon."      The Cycle of Hunger

Title: #PlanPositive
Location: Billericay, East of England, United Kingdom
Story: #PlanPositive    We have all been effected by Covid-19.  Nearly one in five under 15-year olds in the UK lives in a home where the parents can’t afford to put food on the table        The Why?  It's unsurprising that food bank usage in the UK is soaring.    In it's most recent annual analysis  The Trussell Trust  the UK's biggest network of food banks  revealed the number of supply packs it handed out had jumped 19% to a staggering 1.6 million compared to the previous year.    People have been placed in a world of uncertainty. 'When will my next pay cheque be?' 'What will happen to my work?' 'What about my children?' and the big one... 'How am I going to put food on the table?'    South East London is where I grew up  moved away from  and have now returned to work . It is also at the heart of this crisis. With demand up by 500% for the Southwark foodbank it feels only right that I try to give back to the community that helped shape my young life.    5 097 People were fed by Southwark foodbank between 2018 and 2019  996 additional people were helped by Southwark Foodbank last year. A 20% increase on the previous years figures.          The What.  I am looking to donate both food and money to the   Southwark Foodbank  c/o Pecan  121a Peckham High Street  Peckham  London SE15 5SE    The Foodbank provides three days nutritionally balanced emergency food and support to local people who are referred to them in crisis.    A typical food parcel contains a minimum of 3 days of nutritionally balanced  non-perishable  tinned and dried foods .   A typical food parcel includes: breakfast cereal  soup  pasta  rice  pasta sauce  baked beans  tinned meat  tinned vegetables  instant mash  UHT milk  tea  coffee  sugar  tinned dessert and biscuits.     This obviously comes at a cost.     With the government and health officials urging people to stay at home as best as possible  this also puts a strain on the foodbank as it means they now have to deliver the parcels in person by car.          The How  With the guidance of the Southwark Foodbank  I will source and shop all items required and deliver to the food bank for them to distribute accordingly.  You can donate to this page and in return  I will purchase the items and add them to the donation.      How much should I donate?  As much as you can comfortably afford.      You can make a real difference to children  babies  families  and local communities by giving a small amount.

Title: Bishopthorpe Virtual Foodbank Stall
Location: Bishopthorpe, Yorkshire and the Humber, United Kingdom
Story: Hello again!     I hope everyone is well and staying safe.    As you may know  since December 2019 I have organised a monthly collection stall for York Foodbank as part of the Bishopthorpe and Rural West Branch of The Labour Party. Due to lockdown restrictions  I have cancelled all physical collection stalls  you can usually find me outside the CO-OP in Bishopthorpe  come rain or shine!     Instead  last month I decided to run a "virtual" collection stall instead - all the money raised from a crowdfunding page  like this  went towards purchasing specific food items York Foodbank desperately needed. I purchased the food from a local wholesalers (Miller Foods) and had it delivered directly to the Foodbank depot in Clifton Moor.     Last month's virtual collection was a huge success - raising over £600 which was turned into 0.5.tonnes of food delivered directly to York Foodbank.    The need for food banks is greater now than ever before as The Trussell Trust reports a soaring 81% increase for emergency food parcels from food banks in its network during the last two weeks of March 2020  compared to the same period in 2019 – including a 122% rise in parcels given to children  as the coronavirus pandemic continues to unfold.    The Trussell Trust are also running a number of campaigns in order to eradicate the need for foodbanks  any support you can offer (by signing the petitions below) would be great!    https://www.trusselltrust.org/get-involved/campaigns/    This month's donations will go towards purchasing the following items:     • TINNED TOMATOES   • TINNED FRUIT   • RICE   • FRUIT JUICE   • PASTA   • TINNED FISH   • UHT MILK   • CUSTARD OR RICE PUDDING    Thank you and take care.  Corinne x  (Bishopthorpe Ward Organiser)

Title: Equipment upgrade needed to make protective masks
Location: Eastbourne, South East England, United Kingdom
Story: I am a 50yr old single mum to two teenagers who was made redundant end of last year  then just as I landed my perfect job the lockdown was enforced and the position was no longer available.  Finding myself with time on my hands I had started to make reusable and washable face masks when a friend approached me and asked me to supply his local business with 150 of my handmade washable face masks for their key workers to protect themselves whilst working.       After I posted a quick cheeky snap of myself wearing a mask onto social media I started to get requests from people who wanted to purchase them for themselves. I designed and created some gothic inspired designs and demand for them shot up even further  with new orders coming in every hour. The gothic range has proved to be very popular  and new fabrics are being eagerly awaited to create more designs.          Each face mask is made of 6 pieces of fabric  each of which is handcut individually by myself from new clean polycotton fabric. They are 3 layers each with a pocket to add a filter if you so wish  and all have a bendable nose section to allow the mask to fit snuggly over the bridge of the wearers nose. They are finished off with elastic loops which go around the ears. Each mask is then packaged into compostable/recyclable clear poly bags to keep them clean  ready for dispatch.   With a background in community and charity I wanted to make my masks available to families who may not be able to afford to purchase them  but at the same time my venture needs to cover its own costs too. So after some thought as to how I can support others who are less fortunate whist still covering my overheads I decided to donate a face mask to my local Foodbank for every 5 masks I sell. Thus my overheads are covered yet I am still giving back to the community at the same time.    I love creating  and love sewing these masks  however my sewing machine is old and has already broken down once causing a 6 day delay on production while I waited for replacement parts. This fundraiser has been set up as I would like to purchase a new more reliable sewing machine that not only sews  but also embroiders  so I can create more bespoke and custom items that will have my own embroidered designs on them.    Your support is much valued and appreciated  and I believe in paying things forward. So if I successfully hit my target I will make 25 face masks for my local Foodbank so they can distribute them to the families who need their help at this trying time. I will continue     If you have any questions then please feel free to ask  I am always happy to help.    Kind Regards & stay safe  Lucie          'Without people  you are nothing' - Joe Strummer  The Clash.

Title: Home Start NEA
Location: Crimond, Scotland, United Kingdom
Story: "NONE OF US GET THROUGH LIFE ALONE. WE ALL HAVE TO LOOK OUT FOR EACH OTHER AND LIFT EACH OTHER UP"     Quote: Hilary Clinton    Home-Start has a 47-year history of helping families most in need in our communities. As the coronavirus pandemic takes hold  we remain as committed as ever to supporting parents – in their homes and communities – in the critical early years of childhood. Our work builds parental confidence and resilience  enhances attachment  and reduces community isolation. This transforms children’s lives in terms of their health and wellbeing and their emotional  social and educational development.    We are seeing social distancing and isolation placing enormous strain on families. Families with particular pressures such as poor mental health  illness and low wages are being hit hard by the crisis. Home-Starts NEA have moved fast to provide support for these and other families affected. We have moved essential support services on-line to stay connected with families. our staff and volunteers are playing an important part in local community response efforts which include – delivering essential supplies and linking families into local resources such as Foodbanks  meals  and public health services.    In the coming weeks and months we will work harder than ever to find ways to make sure families continue to have the support they need. So much is changing so rapidly right now  but one fact remains – around 2000 babies are born each day in the UK. The practical and emotional demands of parenthood are challenging enough in normal times but the current pandemic adds so many additional layers of anxiety  uncertainty and isolation.    The next few months are going to change our communities for years to come. As we emerge from the current crisis  Home-Start volunteers will play a key part in the wider effort needed to bring families and communities together again.    Like many others  one of our biggest challenges will be securing the income we need to continue this vital work. Local Home-Starts are on the frontline of support yet are already facing substantial financial difficulties. We are taking decisive action wherever we can to reduce our costs without jeopardising the essential services which families depend on us to provide. But with shops closing  fundraising events being cancelled and longer term grant funding at risk  many of our local services will face a significant drop voluntary income in the next few months.    We are grateful for the help of all our friends through this crisis. To come through it strong and be there for families both now and into the future we need you and all our supporters to stay connected with us  invest in our work as generously as you’re able  and  more than ever before  to spread the word – to your colleagues  friends and wider networks. Please believe it  your support and every action you take for us will make a difference.    Thank You all for your continued support. We appreciate this so much.      From All at Home Start NEA

Title: Let’s get Elsie a Ernie!
Location: Stretton, East Midlands, United Kingdom
Story: I know there’s a great deal of more “important” causes going around at the moment  understandably. But it’s still nice to be nice  so I thought I’d set this little Go Fund me page up to hopefully put a big smile on a little girls face.   Quite simply Elsie would love a Tortoise called Ernie - that should be enough for anyone to donate (even if just £1!) as just imagine her little face when her dreams come true! But please read below if you need more reason to donate  thank you Elsie and her mum Lizzie have made me lol every day since I stumbled across them on Instagram (you must follow if you don’t already: Shootitmommaphoto) Lizzie is a single mum  self employed Photographer without work currently (as I know a lot of people are right now) and has been dedicating so much of her spare time to making the rest of us smile. Lizzie has raised £750 by herself (and counting!) for Rutland Foodbank by taking lockdown photos of the residence of Oakham as she walks/bikes past their homes on her walk. The photos are incredible and all the proceeds went to the above charity. They’ve also been making the most AWESOME cover music videos to keep us all entertained during lockdown. Check them out by the way if you haven’t already!     She has put so much time into making lots of us smile - I’ve never met Lizzie in person  I just think it would be just lovely it if we could return the favour.    Her daughter Elsie has her heart on buying a Tortoise and naming him Ernie. Let’s make this happen.   Thank you in advance!    x

Title: Colchester Foodbank Relocation and support
Location: Colchester, East of England, United Kingdom
Story: We need your help and support! Due to unprecedented demand through the COVID19 pandemic people need your help and support with food like never before. The colchester Foodbank (second most popular in the region) has seen unprecedented demand - not only does that present challenges with supply meeting demand  there are also logistical challenges to meet captivity and follow social distancing protocol. Foodbank has been offered a prime town centre location completely free of charge to run operations through this ongoing pandemic  however we need financing and volunteers to make the premises fit for purpose. We need to procure and fit a significant amount of racking and work tables. This will be supplied by a local builders merchants with and army of Volunteers to install it. Any excess funds that go beyond the install and transportation costs of the live will be spent directly on food supplies to make up these vital emergency packages. As always regular updates will show this journey as it progresses so that you you see the fruition of your kind help. Thanks  Martin Leatherdale Centre Manager Lion Walk Shopping Centre

Title: Fight poverty & homelessness in our community
Location: London, Greater London, United Kingdom
OrganizationDetails: Registered nonprofitDonations eligible for Gift Aid.
Story: LIVING WELL BROMLEY is a registered charity helping up to 300 clients  called guests a week. We offer holistic care for guests in our Community Hub  supported by over 80 volunteers.     The services we provide to our guests include:    Crisis support  for high risk individuals who are at immediate risk of becoming homeless as well as those suffering from severe mental health issues including suicide;    Medium to long term support for those with food poverty  lack of funds to pay for gas/electricity  those facing evictions  court appearances or benefit sanctions;    Addressing problems such as homelessness  benefit applications and appeals;    Providing form filling for those who have literacy issues;    Helping our guests access services counselling and make referrals to social services and addiction agencies. As a result  we are witnessing our guests lives being transformed  allowing them to live more independently.    Providing help to resolve debts whilst also looking at the underlying issues of why our guests are in hardship or distress  and providing tools to help them deal with future budgeting.    For those of our guests with learning difficulties  we offer one-to-one words & numbers learning.    We help those with disabilities access services  especially those suffering from mental health issues such as severe depression  which amounts to 64% of our guests.    There is also the increasing problem of social isolation  and we have a community meal on a Friday shared by up to 100 clients  which helps with building support groups  relationships and social interaction.    Would you like to make a difference?    Every donation will help. Thank you in advance for your contribution to this cause that means so much to us.    We are at crisis point. Due to the Coronavirus we are not getting the donations of food and money we need to meet increased demand.    During this pandemic we are having to offer restricted services. Whilst our food bank continues  we still need funds to buy food. Our community lunch is now a take-away meal. To meet the needs of those self-isolating  we are providing a home delivery service and telephone support.    Advocacy services are now being offered remotely.     Help vulnerable people living with serious poverty and homelessness:    Here's how your donation can help:    £16 helps provide towards one week’s worth of food  groceries and toiletries.    £10 will give them one week’s electric/gas supply for those with no money.    £2 for a two-course meal  up to 100 clients come to our community meal every week  which is a take away service at the moment.    £45 will help us attend a court hearing or assessment with them.    £50 will provide a counselling session  a much-needed service among our clients.    If 23 000 people who can afford it donated £5 each  we would be fully funded for a year. Be part of our team by donating whatever you can; even £1 makes a difference. Please pass this information to as many people who can donate.    Together  we can help at-risk people break free of poverty and homelessness!      Read more:    Food Bank & Facilities: we hand out up to 600 food bags a month. Demand has already increased as children are off school  and many families come in so that their children do not have to go hungry. The Clothes Bank runs twice monthly and helps those who cannot afford to buy clothes. Clients can have a shower and wash their clothes  which helps those who are homeless or suffering from fuel poverty.    Community Lunch: we offer a community meal to bring clients together  knowing others are in similar situations gives them opportunity to share their concerns and support each other. In serious mental health cases we refer them to local agencies  or for counselling.    "Britain get talking" is a National campaign being promoted because of the degree of social isolation in the UK  we have a heart for building community and addressing isolation.    Advocacy & Welfare: in just one year this service has grown four-fold. We helped 230 guests last year  of which 57 guests with housing/homelessness issues. We make referrals to homeless shelters/hostels and contact Street Link where appropriate. We also provide help with benefits issues  by accompanying guests to assessment/court hearings and making referrals to adult care services  MIND  BDAS (for drug and alcohol abuse)  as well as detox centres.    Blend Community Choir & much more also Art Therapy: provides social interaction  an opportunity to gain new skills  help clients gain confidence and rebuild their lives. Blend Café & Choir has put on concerts for the local community  some who have attended would not otherwise had access to this type of event. They run storytelling and writing sessions all contribute towards building community.    Podiatry service: Recently homeless and disabled guests have asked for the introduction of a Podiatry service. A company called Forgotten Feet volunteer their service once a month helping up to 8 clients each visit.       During this Coronavirus period we are having to offer restricted services but our food bank continues and our community lunch is now a take away meal. To meet the needs of those self-isolating  we are providing a home delivery service and telephone support. Advocacy services are being offered remotely.       Supported by: Ellie Reed (MP for Penge/Lewisham)  Local Councilors  DWP officer  Police  Trust for London  local schools  businesses and Individuals.     Supermarkets and churches also supply us with food for the foodbank  but we are only getting very small amounts in this very difficult time.

Title: EMERGENCY; Food for Orphanages
Location: Hartley, South East England, United Kingdom
OrganizationDetails: Registered nonprofitDonations eligible for Gift Aid.
Story: EMERGENCY CALL FOR PROVISION OF FOOD IN OUR FOODBANK FOR ORPHANAGES AMIDST THIS GLOBAL PANDEMIC.     As we narrate this story  we have but some food left in our food bank. Food as we all know is one of the most important commodities of life  without it there is no survival. For a while now there has been a shortage of food supply in our Orphanages due to some financial constraints which regrettably is now beyond control. We have thousands of orphanages globally lingering around hope for survival. Before now our food bank has been sponsored and supported by individuals  organizations and anonymous donors who seem to have brought respite and succor from the little they had. We are all aware of what it is to feel hungry or impoverished for a day not to talk of children. We have been emboldened by the love  kindness and support of people who shared in our dreams and intervention which necessitated our donation of food  relief materials and other utilities.     People are filling up their trollies and cupboards to try to deal with the panic of the pandemic - and foodbanks up and down the country are running out of food. Children in the Orphanages are crying out to you who have more than enough to feed to help them during this shutdown. They need your love and support at this critical stage that we are in because we are dealing with a twin war Corona Virus/Hunger Pandemic.     As the impact of coronavirus takes hold  and the knock-on effect of unpaid work  unfulfilled contracts  zero-hours workers getting zero hours  new universal credit claims (currently a six-week delay  who knows how much longer it will be with so many new claims to process)  More and more as we progress we find ourselves on the brink of total collapse.     We are here hoping against all hopes that our children feed at least two (2) meals a day or more. Our plea and intervention  therefore  is for people to share in our project goal to provide food and necessities to reduce the scourge globally.     We don't know when COVID- 19 will stop and there is no gainsaying that the impact of the pandemic has destroyed global economies and would get worst if we don't conquer the hunger rampaging orphanages and the less privileged globally. Developed countries have brought palliatives to their citizens but what about Africa where these twin war (Corona Virus/Hunger Pandermic) have permeated the continent. If we all turn inwards and only look after ourselves  more and more people are going to slip through the cracks. Therefore this is a call for action     All the monies raised will go directly to SINABELAS FOUNDATION who will use it to support all orphanages in need and at risk of food insecurity and hunger.     Every donation made is worthwhile and will go along way in reducing these menace.     If you can't afford to donate - sharing it on social media will help! Thank you for lending a hand to humanity.

Title: PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT AND WORKWEAR
Location: Horwich, North West England, United Kingdom
Story: I am the only civvy volunteer at Bolton Armed Forces Centre For Veterans CIO.The other volunteers are ex forces.There are 6 of us who work there on a regular basis.We are totally unpaid.No expenses.Our centre has extremely limited funding.Even more so now with the Covid-19 situation.Any money we have goes directly to the veterans we help.We help to rehome reintegrate provide a foodbank(stocks are being used constantly during the Covid-19 crisis)mental health resolutions signposting to other forms of help benefits tribunals form filling the list is endless.Applying for grants can be soul destroying with all of the knock backs we get.Times are harder than ever.I would like help in raising funds to pay for all of our volunteers who represent the centre to have full hi-vis and protective clothing. These include hi-vis vests work pants tshirts work shoes gloves and jumpers.It would take a big strain off us financially at the centre and it is agreed that we all want to look smart/uniform and represent our centre across the North West and beyond.I hope you will consider helping us all .Thankyou for your consideration. Please email me at the centre on [email redacted]

Title: Helping the Elderly and Vulnerable during Covid19
Location: Chigwell, East of England, United Kingdom
Story: In my local area a lot of Elderly and vulnerable people are suffering  lost of people who rely on food banks are now unable to get to them because they are isolating or someone in their family is isolating  lots of elderly can't get to the shops and queue for hours to get food and essential item.  I've been spending my own money and trying to help as many people as i can but sadly that can't continue as my own work is slowing down too    Although the Government has said it will help there is a delay and some people are suffering in the meantime  the people who rely on foodbanks and aid from others.  I want to be able to help more  so this will enable me to go out  go to as many houses as i can  buy the items they need  collect the prescriptions they aren't able to queue for  even collect their newspapers  Some elderly people rely on newspapers to feel connected  and i can keep on buying items for the food banks  This won't go on for ever  but as human beings we need to help each other as much as possible  So if you can only give 50pence  it will go towards helping someone who really needs it. I wish i had endless pockets and i didn't need to ask but sadly i don't.  I'm just a normal guy with a normal job who doesnt like to see anyone suffer and if i can help in any way i will.

Title: Save Liverpool FC from Bankruptcy
Location: Burbage, East Midlands, United Kingdom
OrganizationDetails: Registered nonprofitDonations eligible for Gift Aid.
Story: Today  April 4th 2020  Liverpool Football Club revealed the true extent of their financial struggles in the midst of the coronavirus pandemic. Having profited a paltry £42 million pounds in the last financial year  the club  having been deprived of matchday revenue for almost a full three weeks now  seek to furlough it's non-playing staff and resort to using public funds to pay them  such is the degree of the club's financial struggles.     Liverpool join other poor Premier League clubs like Tottenham Hotspurs (8th richest football club in the world  Levy £3m bonus) and Mike Ashley's Newcastle United in the dole queue.    Meanwhile  NHS workers are bathing in money  food and equipment  having been riding the gravy train throughout austerity. Look : https://www.crowdfunder.co.uk/masks4nhsheroes       (@BrianReade    Liverpool CEO Peter Moore Oct '19: "We had this historical figure  Bill Shankly  a Scottish socialist. Today when we speak about business questions  we ask ourselves: 'what would Shankly do?' Doubt he'd have said let the taxpayer pay some wages when you've just made £42m profit.    FSG - please rethink this decision - this is morally wrong and terrible PR. Put the people first.    In reality  all monies raised from this page will benefit Liverpool Six Community Association  and any donation will help make an impact. Thanks in advance for your contribution to this cause.    More information about Liverpool Six Community Association: At our Community Centre we provide advice services  lunch clubs  youth clubs  a foodbank  tea dances  short breaks away for the elderly and children. The children we work with come to the L6 Centre very distressed and hungry. We run a youth club for these disadvantaged children of our community and provide them with a hot meal 3 times a week. We work closely with the local schools and the teachers who refer vulnerable children and families. We also ensure we support families who are deprived at Christmas.)

Today when we speak about business questions  we ask ourselves: 'what would Shankly do?' Doubt he'd have said let the taxpayer pay some wages when you've just made £42m profit.    FSG - please rethink this decision - this is morally wrong and terrible PR. Put the people first.    In reality  all monies raised from this page will benefit Liverpool Six Community Association  and any donation will help make an impact. Thanks in advance for your contribution to this cause.    More information about Liverpool Six Community Association: At our Community Centre we provide advice services  lunch clubs  youth clubs  a foodbank  tea dances  short breaks away for the elderly and children. The children we work with come to the L6 Centre very distressed and hungry. We run a youth club for these disadvantaged children of our community and provide them with a hot meal 3 times a week. We work closely with the local schools and the teachers who refer vulnerable children and families. We also ensure we support families who are deprived at Christmas.)

Title: Food For Families in Saffron Walden
Location: Saffron Walden, East of England, United Kingdom
Story: Hope Community Hub was set up to help the vulnerable in our community. In partnership with TLG 'Make Lunch'  this Easter we were due to run a lunch club for families in need of help over the holiday period. As we are no longer able to run the 'Make Lunch' club  TLG have very kindly donated £200 to help us support local families with food parcels instead. Whilst we are grateful for their donation  local primary schools have told us that they have 30 families in need of help. I don't know about you  but £200 sounds more like a reasonable amount to help one family over Easter than 30! Let's pull together as a community to help families in need. Help us to help these families with food parcels. There is enough anxiety at the moment about Cronovirus; worrying about our families' health  our health  our jobs  families shouldn't need to be worrying about how they can feed themselves as well. I'm going to suggest a target of £3 000. That's £100 of food per family. We are working in partnership with Saffron Walden foodbank and any money raised in addition will be donated to them.

Title: RAISE FOR MANCHESTER CENTRAL FOODBANK AND UNITE
Location: Manchester, North West England, United Kingdom
OrganizationDetails: Registered nonprofitDonations eligible for Gift Aid.
Story: As we find ourselves in an unpredictable situation here @allstarsmcr we have decided to come together and help raise money for MANCHESTER CENTRAL FOOD BANKS which helps provide tonnes of edible food surpluses to the needy who are really struggling in this difficult time. we want to do our bit and help out where we can  therefore we will be donating £0.20 per sale to this good cause as we need to be united in these difficult times and help the less fortunate out.    The times ahead are worrying and concerning for us all but even more so for people who are really struggling even for the bare necessities. Many people may feel embarrassed to ask for help as they probably never imagined being in this situation but its our duty of care to provide aid as we could easily find ourselves in a similar situation.     Lets all pull together as a community as a nation and support our people  as a wise man once said do good for others and good will come to you. #circleoflife #uniteinthistimeofneed

Title: Helping the local foodbanks
Location: Havant, South East England, United Kingdom
Story: Now more than ever some of our vital community resources are struggling hard  I'm stuck at home feeling a bit useless so thought I'd try and raise some funds for the local food banks so they can continue to help the most vulnerable.
